This is all about speed.

We fly to the Mun with infinite fuel.

1) Infinite fuel and clipping allowed.

1) a) Clipping shall be a separate class.

2) Mods and stock parts shall be separate classes.

3) Mechjeb and non mechjeb shall be separate classes.

Permutations of the above rules shall have unique classes

4) You must take a screenshot of a planted flag at the destination you are racing to. The time in the upper left hand corner is your score.

5) Lowest score wins.

6) Using save files is permitted.

-Also accepting races to the Northern Ice Cap on Kerbal.

10:50

I threw this together in a couple minutes just to prove the point that given your conditions, there is a mathematical minimum time to get to the Mun, based on an optimal trajectory and a maximum acceleration attainable by say a seat and a bunch of mainsails, barring any kind of glitchy super speed things, so it's quickly going to turn into who can 'sploit the best.

Solved mathematically:

Maximum acceleration is something like 1372m/s^2 using a mass of fuelless sepatrons on a negligible weight craft.

a = 1372m/s^2

Kerbin radius = 600,000m

Mun altitude = 12,000,000m

Mun radius = 200,000m

So the minimum distance to ever possibly travel is:

12,000,000 - 600,000 - 200,000 = 11,200,000m

We will need to accelerate and decelerate for the same amount of time (lets ignore gravity and atmosphere in this case) so x for acceleration and deceleration is 5,600,000m

x = 5,600,000m

From kinematics we know that...

t = sqrt(x/(.5a))

...for constant acceleration over a distance.

So t for acceleration and deceleration is:

sqrt(5600000/(.5(1372)) = 90s

90s *2 = 180s = 3 minutes.

Funnily enough thats precisely what I guessed before doing these calculations. Granted this is assuming perfect execution, no gravity, no atmosphere, and an acceleration that is probably a bit beyond what a controllable craft like this could have, but whatever, it works.
